org.apache.xml.security.c14n.helper
Class NamespaceSearcher

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.xml.security.c14n.helper.NamespaceSearcher

public class NamespaceSearcher
extends java.lang.Object

This is a utility class which is being used by org.apache.xml.security.c14n.implementations.Canonicalizer20010315WithXPath which offers different methods for searching for namespaces in a document.

  • v: visible node
  • I: invisible node
  • C: context node
  • x: result of selection
 vvvvIIIIIvvvvvIIIIIIvvvvvvvIIIIIIIvvvvvvIIIIIC - input
 xxxx     xxxxx      xxxxxxx       xxxxxx     C - visible selection
                                         xxxxxC - invisible selection

Author:
Christian Geuer-Pollmann

findFirstInvisibleDefaultNSAttr

public org.w3c.dom.Attr findFirstInvisibleDefaultNSAttr()
This method searches the direct invisible ancestors of the context node and returns the first attribute which defines a default NS. It returns null otherwise.

Returns:
Throws:
CanonicalizationException

findFirstVisibleDefaultNSAttr

public org.w3c.dom.Attr findFirstVisibleDefaultNSAttr()
                                               throws CanonicalizationException
This method searches all visible ancestors of the context node and returns the first attribute which defines a default NS. It returns null otherwise.

Returns:
Throws:
CanonicalizationException

findInvisibleNonDefaultNSAttrs

public java.util.Map findInvisibleNonDefaultNSAttrs()
                                             throws CanonicalizationException
Collects all non-default namespace declarations that are being defined in the invisible direct ancestors.

Returns:
a Map which contains the Attr nodes as values and uses the Attribute names as keys.
Throws:
CanonicalizationException

findVisibleNonDefaultNSAttrs

public java.util.Map findVisibleNonDefaultNSAttrs()
                                           throws CanonicalizationException
Collects all non-default namespace declarations that are being defined in the visible ancestors.

Returns:
a Map which contains the Attr nodes as values and uses the Attribute names as keys.
Throws:
CanonicalizationException
